page.title: 14ALL SAINTS CHURCH,BOTLEY
page.content: All Saints church is going to have its aniversary soon.It will be 150 years old so that means it was built in 1835.The church is the only church in Botley.There used to be a Methodist church but it shut down last month,June the 19th 1985.Now it has moved to Hedge End.The clock on All Saints wall used to be in William Cobbett's house.The church holds coffee mornings,flower meetings,widows meetings and old age pensioners meetings.They have links with Fairthorne manor which is the YMCA centre.They also have connections through the PIM with other countries to help them with food and a roof over their head.Fairthorne has planned trips to the New Forest for people that go to the church and people at the YMCA.
